title: HEAD STARTERS
subtitle: Save time with dinners that make tasty use of prepared packaged products, such as frozen spinach, jarred salsa, rotisserie chicken, and refrigerated pizza dough.

components.text: Save time with dinners that make tasty use of prepared packaged products, such as frozen spinach, jarred salsa, rotisserie chicken, and refrigerated pizza dough.
For taco night, serve the shredded pork in small tortillas with sliced radishes and limes for squeezing.

components.html:
2cups chopped white onion (1 large onion)
2½lb. pork shoulder roast
1½tsp. salt
½tsp. black pepper
1(16-oz.) jar green salsa
½cup chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish
2serrano peppers, or to taste

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Spread onion in a 4½- to 5-qt. slow cooker. Sprinkle pork all over with salt and pepper; transfer to slow cooker. Pour salsa over pork, sprinkle with cilantro, and add serranos.
<lede>2.</lede> Cook, covered, on Low until meat falls apart easily, about 8 hours. Gently transfer pork to a platter; shred using 2 forks. Remove and chop serranos.

<lede>3.</lede> Pour cooking liquid through a sieve set over a bowl; return half the liquid to slow cooker along with the strained vegetables and shredded pork. Add chopped serranos to taste. Garnish with additional cilantro.
PER 1-CUP SERVING: 222 CAL; 13G FAT (5G SAT); 19G PRO; 6G CARB (1G FIBER, 3G SUGARS); 485MG SODIUM

“This is fantastic! My husband said this was the best chile verde dish he has tasted in years. I took some to my coworkers, and they raved about it, too.”
– KAT
Top wedges of this quiche with chopped fresh chives.

components.html:
1(9-inch) deep-dish frozen pie crust
2cups shredded Swiss and/or grated Parmesan cheese (8 oz.)
½cup real bacon bits
4eggs, lightly beaten
1cup half-and-half

components.text: <lede>2.</lede> Put frozen pie crust on a baking sheet. Stir together cheese, and bacon bits in a bowl; spread evenly in crust. In the same bowl, whisk together eggs and half-and-half; pour over cheese mixture.
<lede>3.</lede> Bake 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350°F; continue baking until quiche begins to brown, top is puffed, and a knife inserted in center comes out clean, 12 to 15 minutes more.
PER SLICE: 484 CAL; 32G FAT (14G SAT); 22G PRO; 23G CARB (1G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 855MG SODIUM

“I’ve added broccoli, chopped tomatoes, and mushrooms; substituted ham for the bacon; and gone Tex-Mex with pepper Jack, jalapeños and salsa.”
– SUSAN LOGSDON

“I added a can of well-drained crabmeat and fresh spinach, and cooked it 10 minutes longer. I love this recipe. It’s quick and easy and tastes so good!”
– DEE
NEW RECIPE GO ONLINE TO RATE & REVIEW
Give this pasta a burst of color and flavor with chopped fresh parsley and freshly ground black pepper.

components.html:
1(15-oz.) jar Alfredo sauce
1lemon, zested and juiced
1Tbsp. drained capers
½tsp. black pepper
2(5-oz.) cans tuna, drained and flaked
12oz. fettuccine, cooked according to package directions

components.text: Stir together Alfredo sauce, ½ tsp. lemon zest, 3 Tbsp. lemon juice, capers, and pepper in a small saucepan. Stir in tuna; cook over medium heat until heated through, about 5 minutes. Serve over fettuccine.
PER SERVING (1 CUP PASTA AND ⅓ CUP SAUCE): 386 CAL; 14G FAT (8G SAT); 19G PRO; 47G CARB (2G FIBER, 5G SUGARS); 581MG SODIUM
Add a little green to this pizza by sprinkling it with chopped fresh chives after baking.

components.html:
1(16-oz.) pkg. refrigerated pizza dough
4oz. sliced provolone cheese (about 5 slices)
2Bosc pears, thinly sliced
½cup chopped walnuts
½cup crumbled Gorgonzola or other blue cheese (2 oz.)
¼tsp. salt

components.text: Preheat oven to 450°F. Lightly coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Press dough into a 12-inch round on baking sheet; evenly layer on provolone, pears, walnuts, and Gorgonzola. Bake until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown, 13 to 15 minutes. Sprinkle with salt.
PER SLICE: 296 CAL; 13G FAT (5G SAT); 11G PRO; 35G CARB (3G FIBER, 5G SUGARS); 598MG SODIUM

“I used refrigerated crescent roll dough as the crust. For color and some sweetness, I sprinkled ½ cup dried cranberries over the provolone.”
– TERESSA DEJONG DRENTH
Garnish these enchiladas with chopped fresh cilantro and sliced jalapeño peppers.

components.html:
2cups cubed rotisserie chicken
1cup sour cream
¼tsp. salt
¼tsp. black pepper
½cup oil
12(5-inch) corn tortillas
1(4-oz.) can chopped green chiles, drained
2cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese (8 oz.)

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Stir together chicken, sour cream, salt, and pepper in a bowl.

<lede>2.</lede> Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Dip 1 tortilla into hot oil until softened, about 10 seconds. Spoon 1 heaping Tbsp. chicken mixture in a line across middle of tortilla; roll into a cylinder. Transfer enchilada, seam side down, to prepared baking dish. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Sprinkle with green chiles and cheese.
<lede>3.</lede> Bake until cheese has melted and enchiladas are hot, 12 to 15 minutes.
PER SERVING (2 ENCHILADAS): 363 CAL; 22G FAT (11G SAT); 25G PRO; 16G CARB (1G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 469MG SODIUM

“I diced one small onion and two small plum tomatoes and mixed them into the filling. Yummy!”
– YARA CASTILLO
Serve this simple salad in lettuce leaves sprinkled with chopped fresh parsley.

components.html:
½cup sliced or slivered almonds
½cup mayonnaise
1Tbsp. lemon juice
¼tsp. black pepper
4(2.6-oz.) pouches cooked chopped chicken
1celery stalk, chopped

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Toast almonds in a dry skillet over medium heat, shaking skillet frequently, 4 to 5 minutes (they burn easily, so watch carefully).
<lede>2.</lede> Stir together mayonnaise, lemon juice, and pepper in a bowl. Add chicken, celery, and almonds; toss to coat.
PER SERVING: 779 CAL; 63G FAT (9G SAT); 44G PRO; 8G CARB (3G FIBER, 2G SUGARS); 403MG SODIUM

“I substituted shredded carrots for the celery, sunflower seeds for the almonds, and added ¼ cup chopped onion. I served it open-faced on toasted cheese bagels.”
– HEATHER

components.html:
1(15-oz.) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
1(10-oz.) pkg. frozen spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
¾cup grated Parmesan cheese (3 oz.)
¾cup mayonnaise
½tsp. black pepper
¼tsp. garlic powder (optional)
6boneless, skinless chicken breasts

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a 10x15-inch baking pan with foil; lightly coat with cooking spray.
<lede>2.</lede> Stir together artichokes, spinach, Parmesan, mayonnaise, pepper, and garlic powder (if using). Arrange chicken in prepared pan. Cover evenly with artichoke mixture.
<lede>3.</lede> Bake chicken 35 to 40 minutes, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest parts registers 165°F.
PER SERVING (1 BREAST AND ¼ CUP TOPPING): 469 CAL; 28G FAT (6G SAT); 44G PRO; 9G CARB (4G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 477MG SODIUM

“It freezes and reheats well, so I double the chicken recipe and freeze half for a meal later on. Occasionally, I’ll add a can of diced green chiles.”
– STACY

“You can make this with frozen artichoke hearts for a little less sodium. Sprinkle a few capers on top and add a little paprika or cayenne pepper.”
– ITALIANFOODIE
